Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TBillboardCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard
      • harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TBillboardCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class TBillboardCard
extends TCard
    TBillboardCard objects are a specialization of TCard objects, that is they are tombola cards representing the six special cards traditionally composing the tombola billboard. They all have 15 numbers each, but they are usually disposed on three rows with 5 number cells each, with no spaces. Numbers are also displaced following a criteria that is substantially different from "normals" cards.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Harry G Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
    See Also:
    TCard, TCardList, TGame, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard

        grid

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TBillboardCard​(int index)
      Create a special card object representing one of the six cards composing the standard Tombola Billboard. TBillboard objects are special cases of TCard objects, so that they, and all their TCard methods, can be used during a tombola game managed by a TGame object.
      TBillboardCard​(String label, int index)
      Create a special card object representing one of the six cards composing the standard Tombola Billboard. TBillboard objects are special cases of TCard objects, so that they, and all their TCard methods, can be used during a tombola game managed by a TGame object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int checkConformity()
      This method simply doesn't work for billboard cards, so it return a negative value as a recognizable error code.
      int getLinearIndex​(int row, int column)
      Given the classical couple of (row, column) index for a billboard card number, this method returns the linearized index of the same number, that is its position, within the [0, 14] range, on the underlying linear vector.
      int getNumber​(int row, int column)
      Return the number on the billboard card at the specified (row, column) position, using a row index within [0,2] range, as any other TCard object, but a column index within [0,4] range that is different from other TCard object
      TNumberCell[][] getNumberGrid()
      This method return a bi-dimensional, 3 row by 5 column array of TNumberCell objects each containing, as simple JavaBean properties, all info related to a single card number and needed during a game. Consider this data grid as an alternate representation of the billboard card useful to be managed within web applications (i.e with Java ServerFaces technologies, etc.).
      static TCardList getWholeBillboard​(String label)
      Return a list of new cards containing the six "special cards" that compose the classical tombola billboard. You can add this list of TBillboardCard objects to a TCardList list object using the standard addAll() method, so that even billboard cards can can participate to a tombola game, just like any other normal card, eventually be awarded of prizes, etc.

      • Methods inherited from class harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TCard

        asString, checkExtraction, compareByCard, compareByRow, evaluateCheckSum, getBestRowScore, getCurrentMaxEPC, getCurrentMaxEPR, getExtractionCheckCount, getJolly, getJollyIndex, getLabel, getLastChecked, getLastMatched, getLastScore, getLastScoringRow, getMatchedNumbers, getNotes, getNumber, getOwner, getScoreOnRow, getTotalScore, hasLastScoreUsedJolly, isJolly, isMatched, isMatched, matchsAsString, resetCompareResult, resetGameStatus, setNotes, setOwner, uncheckExtraction

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TBillboardCard

        public TBillboardCard​(int index)
        Create a special card object representing one of the six cards composing the standard Tombola Billboard. TBillboard objects are special cases of TCard objects, so that they, and all their TCard methods, can be used during a tombola game managed by a TGame object.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the card to be created. Considering the classical billboard displacement, card are numbered from left to right, from top to down, on a table of two columns by three rows.

      • TBillboardCard

        public TBillboardCard​(String label,
                      int index)
        Create a special card object representing one of the six cards composing the standard Tombola Billboard. TBillboard objects are special cases of TCard objects, so that they, and all their TCard methods, can be used during a tombola game managed by a TGame object.
        Parameters:
        label - the prefix to be used to give a name to the billboard card. Its name will be formed by the passed string followed by the ordinal number of the card, a single digit number in the range [1,6].
        index - the index of the card to be created. Considering the classical billboard displacement, card are numbered from left to right, from top to down, on a table of two columns by three rows.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber​(int row,
                     int column)
        Return the number on the billboard card at the specified (row, column) position, using a row index within [0,2] range, as any other TCard object, but a column index within [0,4] range that is different from other TCard object
        Overrides:
        getNumber in class TCard
        Parameters:
        row - index of the requested number within the [0,2] range
        column - index of the requested number within the [0,4] range
        Returns:
        the requested number (always present in that position if (row, column) indexes are within proper ranges)

      • checkConformity

        public int checkConformity()
        This method simply doesn't work for billboard cards, so it return a negative value as a recognizable error code.
        Overrides:
        checkConformity in class TCard
        Returns:
        always -2

      • getLinearIndex

        public int getLinearIndex​(int row,
                          int column)
        Given the classical couple of (row, column) index for a billboard card number, this method returns the linearized index of the same number, that is its position, within the [0, 14] range, on the underlying linear vector.
        Overrides:
        getLinearIndex in class TCard
        Parameters:
        row - the row index within the [0,2] range
        column - the column index within the [0,4] range
        Returns:
        the linearized index of the number in (row, column) position

      • getNumberGrid

        public TNumberCell[][] getNumberGrid()
        This method return a bi-dimensional, 3 row by 5 column array of TNumberCell objects each containing, as simple JavaBean properties, all info related to a single card number and needed during a game. Consider this data grid as an alternate representation of the billboard card useful to be managed within web applications (i.e with Java ServerFaces technologies, etc.).
        Overrides:
        getNumberGrid in class TCard
        Returns:
        a [3,5] array of TNumberCell representing the billboard card

      • getWholeBillboard

        public static TCardList getWholeBillboard​(String label)
        Return a list of new cards containing the six "special cards" that compose the classical tombola billboard. You can add this list of TBillboardCard objects to a TCardList list object using the standard addAll() method, so that even billboard cards can can participate to a tombola game, just like any other normal card, eventually be awarded of prizes, etc.
        Parameters:
        label - the label prefix to be used for each of the six billboard cards
        Returns:
        a TCardList instance containing the six billboard cards.
